EmailTemplate.subject: The Tracker Backlog—MAR 2019 Newsletter
EmailTemplate.textOnly: March 2019 Newsletter The Tracker Backlog is back! Our newsletter is back! In this March issue, we’re excited to bring you: two great new features Reviews <#reviews> and our new Tracker-Slack integration <[[#slack]]>; a Tracker new user webinar <[[#nuw]]>; a Product Stack webinar—How to Manage Complex Requirements in an Agile World <[[#ps]]>; the Tracker User Group (TUG <[[#tug]]>); and last but not least, a blog on Using Tracker to communicate epic hypothesis statements <[[#epics]]>. Managing Reviews made simpler! With the release of our newest major feature (Reviews), we’ve received a record amount of feedback from users like you! We’re using all of this fantastic feedback to shape how Reviews will evolve going forward, and also have some first round improvements that we’re ready to share with you. Review Reviews <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/managing-reviews-made-simpler]]> Introducing: New Slack integration Some things just go together: bread and butter, Batman and Robin, and now Tracker and Slack! Check out the new Pivotal Tracker app for Slack that helps connect the work your team has prioritized with the communication tool you love to use. Slack it to me <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/pivotal-tracker-and-slack-project-updates-just-got-easier]]> Webinar: Introduction to Tracker March 20, 1pm EDT/10am PDT Are you new to Pivotal Tracker? Join us for this free webinar covering Tracker basics—including creating a project and adding, estimating, and prioritizing stories—as well as workflow and automatic planning. Intro to Tracker <[[https://pivotal.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_PDqOWs5gQder9BgNPkPI9g]]> Webinar: Managing Complex Requirements in an Agile World March 21, 2pm EDT/11am PDT More and more, teams are looking to develop faster, react faster, and plan faster—even companies building complex software and hardware products. Do you have the skills to properly balance moving fast while still documenting and maintaining complicated requirements? Manage Complexity <[[https://register.gotowebinar.com/register/6246187415904966915]]> Webinar: Next TUG (aka Tracker User Group) March 28, 1pm EDT/10 am PDT Share all your Tracker knowledge and pick up a few new things by joining our next online Tracker User Group. Next boat sails on March 28. Sail on the TUG <[[https://pivotal.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_C5ph_CMZQpGL0bC1gZu49g]]> Blog: Using Tracker to Communicate Epic Hypothesis Statements By directing casual users to a list of epics, we have found that they can stay informed about the product team’s progress without getting mired in the details of the Features backlog. And they are more likely to remain engaged in the agile XP process. Hypothesize <[[https://www.pivotaltracker.com/blog/using-tracker-to-communicate-epic-hypothesis-statements]]>
